alert.note: Alert for Mountains Southwestern Shasta County to Western Colusa County; Shasta Lake Area, Northern Shasta County (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 02 at 12:42PM PST until March 06 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM SATURDAY TO 10 AM PST MONDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3 feet above 2000 feet and 2 to 12 inches possible down to 1000 feet. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Shasta Lake Area / Northern Shasta County and Mountains Southwestern Shasta County to Western Colusa County Counties including Interstate 5. * WHEN...From 4 AM Saturday to 10 AM PST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be very difficult to impossible with the potential for prolonged road closures. Blowing snow will cause white-out conditions at times. Downed trees and tree limbs with power outages are possible due to heavy snow and gusty winds. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels 1000 to 2000 ft, briefly lower on Sunday and Monday mornings. Heaviest snow expected on Saturday morning and into the afternoon, and again late Saturday night. Travel impacts along with additional snow accumulations are possible into Tuesday and Wednesday.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. Check the latest road conditions by visiting CalTrans at quickmap.dot.ca.gov or calling 800-427-7623 (ROAD).
